page.title: 11TIBBERTON RESIDENTS
page.content: The Landlord of the{Sutherland Arms says his pub is the main meeting place for the village. They have no childrens area but the patio windows open on to a lawn where parents can leave their children. A {Youth Club}has recently been formed which is quite popular but most teenagers prefer to go to Newport. There is fishing on the river, tennis courts and playing fields. A bowling green has been planned for a few years. The oldest resident, born in 1888 says there are too many new houses and people are far less sociable than before. Development is controlled by Wrekin District Council to prevent the village becoming too big. Mrs. Clark thinks the 2 shops are adequate for a small village.
